loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 48-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and the mother of five children.

Yusra is looking to improve her family's life conditions. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 27-year-old food stall owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling food for the past three years and the business is doing great.

This marks her second business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase assorted food, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. 


She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to excel in the business

loans.use: to purchase assorted food, new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children.
 
Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. 

She has requested a loan of 1,500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Bor. She sells food and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children;  two of them are still in school. 

Martha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 SDG in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 46 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store.

Remedios has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman, mother of three children. Thirty-nine years ago, Fatima started working as a tailor. This long experience gave her customers trust and made them supportive. Most of Fatima's customers are neighbors, relatives and friends.

Fatima is a hard-working woman who sacrifices her life for the sake of her children. Fatima has been an Al Majmoua borrower for eight cycles, and almost all of her loans were used to pay for treatment for her child's illness. And still she would do anything in order to continue his treatment. She is a borrower in good standing.

Fatima is applying for a loan this time in order to improve her business, through buying a new, updated tailoring machine necessary for her business. This machine will help a lot in increasing her income, at the same time covering her son's medical expenses. She hopes to stay healthy and capable of covering almost all of her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a new tailoring machine necessary for her business

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 47 years old, widowed, and has two children. She owns a rental house and earns a profit of about 10,000 KES a month.

Annastacia is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy some building materials. She hopes to improve her family’s living standards and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building.

loans.name: Deysi Dolores

texts.es:
Deysi, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y cinco hijos de 25, 22, 20, 18 y 9 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo atienden  labores agrícolas y ganaderas, tienen vacas en su lugar de residencia, sus hijos tambien le apoyan para algunas labores.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de quintales  de concentrado para el ganado, esto le ayudara para que su ganado se mantenga y produzca leche.
El objetivo de Deysi es apoyar a su esposo, que su ganando cuente con lo necesario en alimentación ya que así producirán más leche.
texts.en:
Deysi, age 39, lives with her husband and her five children, ages 25, 22, 20, 18 and 9.  She and her husband tend to the farming and livestock work together.  They have cows where they live.  Their children also help them with some of the work.

She is requesting a loan to buy “quintales” (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrated feed for the livestock.  This will help her maintain the livestock, and it will help with milk production.

Deysi’s objective is to support her husband and for her cattle to have the food they need.  This way they will produce more milk.

loans.use: to buy “quintales” (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrated feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana, vive con dos hijos de 21 y 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, ella es empleada y a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, las ventas la realiza con sus compañeras de trabajo y algunos vecinos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, ropa interior, lociones, cremas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar sus ingresos y para tener mejor variedad.
El objetivo de Ana es que algún día se pueda comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her two children aged 21 and 23. As well as being a maid, she sells clothing and accessories to her work colleagues and neighbours. 

Ana is seeking a loan to buy blouses, underwear, lotions, and creams. This purchase will help her earn more money and have a wider variety of items to sell.

Her long-term goal is to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear, lotions, and creams

loans.name: Bismark

texts.es:
Bismark reside en un barrio muy  poblado del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha vivido toda su vida, desde pequeño aprendió a generar sus propios ingresos,  desde entonces adquirió experiencia como Barbero, esto  le ha permitido llevar siempre el sustento a su hogar.

En la actualidad tiene su propia Barbería, ubicada en su vivienda, donde brinda el servicio de corte de cabello a caballeros de todo el municipio de El Sauce. Es un negocio concurrido, sobre todo por jóvenes que acuden a este lugar por el buen servicio y la agilidad del mismo.

En estos momentos necesita un crédito para compra de cemento, perlines y ladrillos,  para mejorar su vivienda, dando así mejores condiciones de vida a su familia,  un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por este motivo  se acercó a Ceprodel para solicitar su apoyo, con la esperanza  que le puedan ayudar con dicha solicitud, confía en Dios poder lograr  sus objetivos,      mantener su negocio y a sus clientes satisfechos. Le estará agradecido a esta institución.
texts.en:
Bismark lives in a densely-populated neighbourhood in the municipality of El Sauce where he’s lived his whole life. As a child he learned how to earn his own money and eventually became a barber. This work has enabled him to support his family.

Currently he has his own barbershop located in his house where he cuts the hair of men from all over El Sauce. It’s very busy as young people above all go there because of the good service and skills provided by Bismark.

Now he needs a loan to buy cement, metal beams, and bricks to improve his house. His family will have a better place to live and his clients a more comfortable environment. For this reason Bismark has approached Ceprodel to ask for their support. He hopes that the institution will be able to help him, and he trusts in God that he will be able to achieve his goals, continue with his business, and have satisfied clients. He is grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal beams, and bricks

loans.name: Marlyn Raquel

texts.es:
Marlyn, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con sus dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, la casa es familiar, ella tiene dos años de estar en la venta de ropa y es empleada, de estas dos ocupaciones ha logrado mantener a sus hijos y brindarles lo necesario.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más mercadería, porque quiere mejorar y crecer en las ventas, comprara blusas, faldas, ropa interior, camisas, con esto estará diversificando el negocio.
Su aspiración es mejorar el negocio a través de los préstamos, ya que su familia depende de ella directamente.
texts.en:
Marlyn sells clothing. She lives with her two children aged 12 and 8 in the family home. She’s had her clothes-selling job for two years and works as a maid as well. These two jobs enable her to support her children and provide them with the basic necessities.

Marlyn is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise as she wishes to grow her business and make more sales. She plans to buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and shirts and in this way diversify her stock. Her goal is to improve her business by accessing loans as her family depends on her directly.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear, and shirts

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old, married, and has two children.He sells cereals, which he has been doing for four years. His monthly income from the business is 20,000 KES.

Francis is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy cereals cereals, such as rice and maize, beans, and green gram (mung beans) to sell. Francis hopes to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, such as rice and maize, beans, and green grams.

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.ru: Идимох трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина Она замужем и любящая мать пятерых детей. Она занимается купле- продажей детской одежды в торговом центре. Она приобретает товар 1-2 раза в неделю. Когда она ездит за товаром её дочери помогают по бизнесу. Имеет много постоянных клиентов. Идимох запрашивает займ для покупки детской одежды с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Idimoh is a hardworking and purposeful woman. She is married and the loving mother of five children. She is engaged in buying and selling children's clothing at the mall. She purchases goods 1-2 times per week. When she travels to get the goods, her daughters help with the business. Idimoh has many regular customers. 

Idimoh requests a loan for the purchase of children's clothing with a goal of expanding her business. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Flora works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Flora is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding lives in Bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Ding heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cristina es una joven emprendedora de 21 años que vive en Santo Domingo, que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Esta ciudad y cantón es la capital de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Cristina desde que era adolecente traba vendiendo cosméticos y ropa para poder aportar a su economía. Ella trabaja y estudia. Al momento ella está cursando la educación universitaria. Cristina desea invertir en ropa y cosméticos para así incrementar su Stock y de esta manera dar más variedad a su clientela y por ende incrementar sus ventas.

Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida, para ello se valdrá de su primer préstamo y así logrará la inversión planificada.
texts.en:
Cristina is a young 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Santo Domingo, which is the fourth most populous city in Ecuador. Its population is starting to grow rapidly, as it has a rich commercial sector and the largest cattle market in the country. It is located in the humid tropical region of Latin America. This city and canton is the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which is considered a new province, since it was created in 2007.

Since she was teenager, Cristina has worked selling cosmetics and clothing, to be able to contribute to her finances. She works and goes to school. At the moment, she is going to university. Cristina wishes to invest in clothing and cosmetics to increase her stock, and this way offer her customers more variety and thereby increase her sales.

She wishes to improve her quality of life, so she will make use of her first loan and accomplish the planned investment.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 27 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Loida runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 28, is married to Leah and they are blessed with one child. He has been selling clothes and shoes for the last four years. His monthly income from the business is KES 65,000.

This is Paul’s second loan from KADET LTD and he has a good credit history. He will use the loan to buy more clothes and shoes. Paul hopes to open another boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Herberth Ovidio

texts.es:
Herberth, es comerciante de mariscos, vive con su esposa y en casa propia, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad,  tiene 15 años de estar en el negocio, vendiendo todos los días.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en pescado, camarones, ostras, conchas, que con ello espera  mejorar el servicio a los clientes, surtiéndolo de productos frescos.
La aspiración de Herberth es tener mayores ganancias y rentabilidad en su negocio, para beneficiar a la familia.
texts.en:
Herberth is a seafood merchant. He lives with his wife in his own house and has two sons, who are 8 and 2 years of age. He has had his business, selling fish everyday, for 15 years.

Herberth is applying for a loan to invest in fish, shrimp, oysters, scallops so that he can improve service to his customers by stocking fresh products. His aspiration is to earn more income and profit in his business in order to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, oysters and scallops.

loans.name: Guillermo Manuel

texts.es:
Guillermo es un joven de 25 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por la Laguna de Huacachina la cual se encuentra rodeada por dunas y es uno de los atractivos turísticos de la ciudad; como buen peruano le guata mucho la comida, por ello uno de los paltos favoritos es el riquísimo Lomo saltado, el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas.

Guillermo trabaja actualmente como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 45 clientes el dia, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Guillermo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar un equipo de autoradio para su vehículo con el cual hará que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos cuando usen sus servicios, así los clientes estarán satisfechos y el seguirá trabajando para seguir día a día luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una mototaxi propia”.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 25 year old young man who lives in the city of Ica. The city is characterized by its hot climate throughout all seasons of the year and also by the Laguna de Huacachina (Huacachina Lake), which is surrounded by sand dunes and is one of the tourist attractions of the city. Like a good Peruvian, Guillermo greatly enjoys food and one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious “loma saltado.” He studied until the fifth grade in high school but would have liked to study systems engineering.

Guillermo currently works as a motor taxi driver and spends about 12 hours every day at his business and can transport up to 45 clients a day. He believes his business is doing well because he provides good service to his customers.

Guillermo is very grateful to Kiva lenders since with their help he will be able to buy car radio equipment for his vehicle so that his customers will feel more comfortable while using his service. Thus they will be satisfied and he will continue working and fighting day after day to fulfill his great dream of owing his own motor taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a car radio for his vehicle.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children.
 
Akech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her third loan from BRAC. 

She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is 46 years old and single. Six years ago she opened a small grocery store in her village and is very proud of this step, because she is working hard to prove that although she is a woman, she can make a successful business of her own.

Hala is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which will help her increase her selection of merchandise with special goods bought with special offers. Hala is a hardworking woman with an excellent reputation, liked by most of her customers who work hard on supporting her to develop her business as much as she can. In addition to food and candies, Hala also sells kitchenware products and hopes to expand her business by starting to sell most household items.

loans.use: to increase her selection of merchandise.

loans.name: Allakandeme Group

texts.fr:
Allakademe est un regroupement de 5 femmes ayant en moyenne 44  ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à Bounounkobougou, un des quartiers de la ville de Yanfolila (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beignet au poisson avec Noumousso , de la restauration et de la vente de céréales.
Noumousso, avec un poisson et une poêle en main  compte acheter avec son  prêt 100kg de farine,  20kg de poissons, 30litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de YANFOLILA.auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de YANFOLILA et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et d’enfants, en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement ou hebdomadairement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000.FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Allakademe is a group of five women who are, on average, 44 years old and have six children.  They all live in traditional families in Bounounkobougou, one of the districts of the city of Yanfolila (the third administrative region of Mali).
They have taken out their eighth joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers.  Along with Noumousso, these women are in the business of selling fried fish and cereals, and food service.
Noumousso, with a fish and a frying pan in her hand, plans to buy 100 kg. of flour, 20 kg. of fish, and 30 liters of oil with her loan.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Yanfolila from wholesalers.  She makes her sales at the market in Yanfolila and from home to a clientele composed mainly of women and children, at retail, for cash and on credit, payable daily or weekly. 
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 32,000 FCFA.   A part of this will be used to assist her husband with daily expenses and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing fried fish.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is from Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Antonina is widowed and has six children. 

To make a living, Antonina owns a fish selling business venture. She has been engaged in her business for twenty-nine years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Antonina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Luisa ; ella tiene  44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos;  La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de compra y venta de libros, también cosméticos  por catalogo,  la socia desea invertir en la compra de libros al por mayor ella ha hecho un pedido que le llegara en dos semanas y para ello requiere pagar el total del envió.  La socia también invertirá el préstamo para comprar algunos productos de belleza en oferta  por catalogo.
Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, a la atención de la tienda de abarrotes, a la elaboración de tortas, a la venta de tejidos, a la docencia, al servicio de taxi,   atención de su pollería.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa belongs to the “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS” Communal Bank. The bank is located in Huanchac district, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Luisa is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She divides her time between her business buying and selling books and also selling cosmetics by catalog. She wants to invest in the purchase of books wholesale and has requested that they arrive in two weeks and therefore is required to pay the total shipping costs. She will also invest the loan in the purchase of some beauty products on sale in the catalog.

Other members of the bank work at buying and selling construction materials, managing a grocery store, making tortas, selling woven goods, teaching, driving a taxi and running a poultry shop.

Luisa is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase some discounted beauty products by catalog.

loans.name: Anon

texts.en:
Anon lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Anon heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna Isabel habita una comunidad  Los Limones un poblado cercano al municipio de El Sauce de donde es originaria, Se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria donde tiene muchos años de experiencia, oficio que le ha permitido tener su propia vivienda, bienes del hogar con el fin de tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.

Tiene varios años de trabajar con Ceprodel se  le han otorgado cuatro  créditos para la compra de ganado, lo que hoy agradece porque gracias a estos créditos ha aumentado su inventario ganadero de donde obtiene beneficios como la leche de sus vacas que le sirven para el sustento de su familia o la ganancia de la venta de teneros para invertirla en mejoras de su vivienda.

En estos momentos tiene la necesidad de adquirir otro préstamo para compra de terneros con el fin de engordarlos y venderlos en un período de un año y con dicha ganancia adquirir un bien o mejorar su vivienda por lo que espera nuevamente el apoyo de ceprodel ya que de otra manera no pudiera realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel lives in Los Limones, a village near to the municipality of El Sauce, which is where she originally comes from. She works as a primary school teacher and has many years of experience in this profession. The job has allowed her to buy her own home and household articles, thus providing her family with a better quality of life.

She has worked with Ceprodel for several years. They have already given her four loans to buy livestock. Reyna Isabel is very grateful for this help, because thanks to these loans she had increased her stock of cattle. This has provided her with benefits such as milk from the cows, which she uses to feed her family, and income from selling calves. She invests this money in home improvements. 

Reyna Isabel currently needs another loan to buy calves. Her plan is to fatten them up and sell them in a year’s time. With the proceeds she hopes to buy a property or make improvements to her home. She hopes that Ceprodel will help her once again, since this is the only way she will be able to fulfil her aims.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: Don José Medardo es casado con 4 hijos, algunos de sus hijos son estudiantes y dependen de el, su esposa se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa nueva. Anteriormente don José trabajaba como maestro de educación primaria y por problemas de salud tuvo que dejar su trabajo, siendo que el no quería ser una carga para su familia decidió poner una chiclera en el parque de la comunidad. El préstamo que don José solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de todo tipo de dulces, chicles, chocolates, galletas, confites, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su chiclera y seguir aportando para la alimentación, educación y salud de sus hijos. Los ingresos de don José no son muchos, así que su mayor deseo es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar. Don José es cliente de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: José Medardo is married with 4 children. His children all go to school and depend on him. His wife sells shoes and new clothing. Previously, José worked as a primary school teacher but because of health issues he had to leave his job. As he didn’t want to be a burden on his family, he decided to open a candy stand in the community park. José is requesting a loan to invest in the buying of all kinds of sweets, gum, chocolates, cookies, candies, etc. With this loan, he can stock his candy stand and continue to contribute financially to the feeding, education and health of his children. José’s income is not very much so his biggest dream is to increase his income in order to improve the household earnings. José has been a client of FAMA for many cycles and has always paid his loans on time.

loans.use: buy sweets, gum, chocolates, cookies, candies, etc.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en: Basilia is 43 years old, married, and has six children. With two children in school, Basilia works very hard to provide for them. Basilia runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store. Basilia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, soaps, and other miscellaneous items. In the future Basilia would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Abul

texts.en: Abul lives in Bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. Abul heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and sugar for her food stall. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kantus Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Kantus” es un banco comunal que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por personas responsables. Sus reuniones del banco comunal van a ser cada treinta días y todos los socios tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas sino van a pagar una multa. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad. Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. (La socia Isabel está levantando la mano en la fotografia). 

La socia Isabel vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.). Isabel nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante donde expende desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ella abre el restaurante desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de noche de lunes a domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza, gaseosas y otras cosas que se necesitan para preparar comida. 

La socia Isabel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Kantus” is part of the Arariwa Association and was formed by responsible people. The meetings will be every 30 days and every member must be in attendance or they will be fined. A majority of the members are neighbors and have good friendships. The members are hard-working entrepreneurs who look for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts hope to give their children a better future. 

Isabel, (the one with her hand up in the photo), lives in the city of Cusco. Cusco is a well-known tourist destination because of its traditional fiesta of the sun, “Inti Raymi” and because it is the stepping stone to one of the wonders of the world, “Machupicchu”.
Isabel tells us that she sells food. She has a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She opens at 7 in the morning and closes at 9 in the evening, Monday to Sunday. She’s been running this business for many years now and it’s going quite well. She is requesting this loan to buy more beer, soda and other ingredients she needs to prepare food. 

Isabel is grateful for the opportunity she has been given through this Association and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy more beer, soda and other ingredients she needs to prepare food.

loans.name: Gemeniano

texts.en:
Gemeniano is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 55 years old,  married, and has five children. Gemeniano has a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for 31 years and earns 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Gemeniano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to do business. Gemeniano is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Abul

texts.en:
Abul lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Abul heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is a married woman who has two children. Narcisa is 49 years old and lives at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Narcisa owns and operates a business selling jewelry. She has been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional jewelry and accessories to sell. In 2008, Narcisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Narcisa wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and accessories to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 31 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. She earns a living operating a service-based business, providing transportation to local community members. She's been doing this for seven years and earns about PHP 5,000 a month from her work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,00 to repair a vehicle she uses in her business. In 2008, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is married and has three children who range in age from one to 10 years old. For the last year, she has earned a living by selling clothing and earns about KES.10,000 per month. She is applying for her first loan, for KES.30,000, from KADET LTD to buy more clothing to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sale.

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 11 y 13 años, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, Mala es un valle de origen aluviónico, formado por la presencia del río del mismo nombre, tiene  elevaciones de regular altitud constituida por lomas y contrafuertes andinos que en ocasiones llegan hasta el litoral; presenta también como zona geográfica destacada, llamada "Los Platanales", constituida por terrenos antaño muy húmedos y salitrosos, donde afloraba abundante agua del subsuelo debido a la presencia de una napa freática situada a poca profundidad, que hacía propicios dicho terrenos para el cultivo de frutales como el plátano maleño y la vid., como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida, y uno de sus platos favoritos es la riquísima “Carapulcra”, Rocio solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado computación e informática, por ello ella lucha cada dia para salir adelante para lograr que sus hijos que son lo mas importante que tiene en la vida sean mejores que ella.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes y útiles de aseo, ella le dedica su negocio alrededor de 15 horas al día  y atiende diariamente a 25 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le presta mucha atención a sus clientes y los atiene de manera amable.

Roció está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como útiles escolares (cuadernos, folders, mochilas, lapiceros, entre otros), así podrá tener una mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día a día para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Rocío, 34, is the mother of two children who are 11 and 13 years old; she lives in the city of Ica.  Mala is an alluvial valley formed by the river of the same name.  It has regular elevations consisting of hills and Andean foothills which sometimes reach the coastline.  It also has a geographic area that stands out called “Los Platanales” which used to include very humid, salty terrain where there was quite a bit of subterranean water due to the presence of  low-lying cold water located at a shallow depth that make the soil apt for fruit farming, especially Mala bananas and grapes.  

Like all good Peruvians, she likes the food very much and one of her favorite dishes is the very delicious “Carapulcra.”  Rocío only completed fifth grade of secondary school but she would have like to have studied computer and information sciences.  Because of this she strives daily to get ahead so that her children who are the most important things she has in life will be better than her. 

With much effort she managed to have her own grocery and cleaning supplies business.  She spends about 15 hours daily at work and sees about 25 customers daily.  She believes that she does well in her business because she pays attention to her customers and tends to them in a kindly way.

Rocío is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy more merchandise for her store like school supplies (notebooks, folders, backpacks and pencils, among others) and she will be able to have a wider variety of products to improve her income which will allow her to continue to strive daily to reach her greatest dream: “To own her own house and give her children a good education.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Esnarda

texts.en:
This is Esnarda, 64, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with three children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Esnarda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a five pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells herbal and food supplements for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 42,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esnarda dreams of being able to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is 38 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Jovita used her last loan to buy small-sized dividers to organize her display of inventory. Her business grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She hopes to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Karla Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Karla Cristina habita en su propia vivienda con su esposo e hijo, la que construyó y han mejorado gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo y pequeños créditos que han obtenido de micro financieras.

Es una profesional que se gana la vida laborando como profesora de secundaria, en un centro privado del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha brindado sus servicios por muchos años, su trabajo le gusta ejercerlo porque comparte el pan del saber, tiene la esperanza de educar a jóvenes que son el futuro para nuestro país.

Tiene un año de trabajar con Ceprodel, en la actualidad se acercó de nuevo  con la esperanza que le otorguen su segundo crédito, para la compra de zinc, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra, ya que desea mejorar la cocina de su vivienda para tener mejor  condición  de vida para ella y su familia, lo que espera poder seguir trabajando con esta institución, y seguir obteniendo su apoyo y lograr sus metas.
.
texts.en:
Karla Cristina lives with her husband and son in their own house that they built and have been renovating, thanks to hard work and the credits they’ve received from micro financing.

She’s a professional and makes her living working as a secondary school teacher in a private center in the municipality of El Sauce. She’s taught there for many years and enjoys sharing the bread of knowledge and educating young students, for they are future of this country.

She’s been with Ceprodel for 1 year now. She is requesting her 2nd loan to buy zinc, cement, sand and pay for manual labor to renovate the kitchen in her house in order to improve the quality of life of her family. She hopes to continue her work with Ceprodel, continue receiving loans and continue attaining her goals.

loans.use: buy zinc, cement, sand and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: Ludivina works hard to support her family. She is married and earns a living by running a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for five years, and earns additional income by selling ready-to-wear clothing. Ludivina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anai

texts.en:
Anai lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are in school. 
Anai heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Angelita has been in this business for 2 years. Angelita earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Flor Viviana

texts.es:
Flor tiene 25 años de edad, junto a su esposo tiene un maravilloso hijo, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, Ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete. También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo, su esposo la apoya en todo lo que ella hace y a pesar de que el trabaja en un taller mecánico siempre ve la manera de ayudarla en su pequeño negocio.

Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una tienda de abarrotes, luego realizando limpieza a viviendas ajenas y también en el campo, con mucho esfuerzo ahorro y logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa ambulatoria, en la que trabaja actualmente, ella ofrece sus productos a todas las persona que van al mercado de su barrio dese hace ya 2 años, los clientes ya la conocen es por ello que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio, además que es muy amable y detallista con sus clientes.

Flor agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (uniformes escolares y ropa de verano), así podrá tener una mayor variedad de productos y mejorara sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y tener un local propio para vender sus productos”.
texts.en:
Flor, 25, lives with her husband and her wonderful son.  Her dwelling is located in the city of Imperial, a city noted for the important commercial activity of its residents.  Around it are found the Ungará Fort, the last vestige of the Huarco culture, ancient Cañete.  Also found are old haciendas built among extensive farming tracts.  Her husband supports her in everything she does and despite his working in a repair shop always finds a way to help her out in her small business.

She used to work in a grocery store and then cleaning other people’s houses; she also worked in the fields.  With much effort she saved up and managed to get this business of selling clothes from place to place that she works in at present.   She offers her wares to all the people who go to her neighborhood’s market.  She’s been in business for two years already and she’s known by her customers which is why she thinks she does well in her business.  Besides, she’s very kind and detail oriented with her customers.

Flor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (school uniforms and summer clothes) to have a wider variety of products and thus improve her income to continue striving toward her greatest dream: “To provide her son with a profession and to have a locale of her own in which to sell her products.”

loans.use: to buy school univorms and summer clothes.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 44-year-old Lebanese man who is married and lives with his wife and their four school-aged children. He strives to work really hard in order to improve their life and pay his children’s school fees. He has worked as a furniture painter since 1995 and has many years of experience. He’s a reputable man who has gained a fair number of clients so far. Now, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new paint, tools and supplies. He says that that this will speed up his work and increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to buy more paint, tools and supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 40 years old, married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Gloria has taken out and repaid three loans from NWTF before this one. She has run her general store for three years and also earns money by selling salted peanuts and by food vending. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Juana Gladis

texts.es: Juana Gladis de treinta y siete años de edad vive con sus hijos. Ella tiene una venta de productos varios, medicina natural, ropa para dama y caballero, y productos de uso personal,  es muy conocida en la zona y últimamente ha tenido más demanda de parte de sus clientes, pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles; Juana es una mujer honrada y muy dedicada a su trabajo, piensa que hay que verse a sí mismo como un ganador para poder actuar como uno, ella ya se siente una triunfadora, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar medicina natural, ropa, cosméticos etc. Juana Gladis tiene la esperanza que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana Gladis, 30, lives with her children. She sells various products, natural medicine, women’s and men’s clothing and personal care products. She’s well known in her area and lately she’s had higher demand from her clients as her products are of good quality and affordable prices. Juana is an honorable person and very dedicated to her work. She thinks you have to see yourself as a winner to be one. She sees herself as triumphant and that’s why she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will help her buy natural medicine, clothing, cosmetics, etc. Juana Gladis hopes that this will help her improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy natural medicine, clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Erlinda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and widowed with 7 children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening, buying and selling charcoal,  running a cafeteria and direct selling of Avon products.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph still sells clothes, with a good income. This is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy  more clothes for sale. Joseph hopes to open another boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy  more clothes for sale

loans.name: Poetas Group

texts.es: Rodrigo tiene 30 años de edad, platica que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria en su localidad, después como no vio futuro en su población decidió irse a radicar unos años a la ciudad de México donde se metió a una escuela de estilistas y donde aprendió muy bien el oficio dice que desde niño le llamaba la atención hacer cortes de pelo y ver que era un buen negocio y por eso escogió esa carrera. Actualmente tiene una estética desde hace 7 años en población y platica que uno de sus desafíos es el pagar la renta ya que son muy elevadas tarifas. Comenta que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, maquillajes pintura de uñas ya que hace manicure y pedicura, shampoo, tintes, decolorantes, líquidos para hacer bases en el cabello. Platica que  todos los productos que  aplica a sus clientes los compra en la ciudad de México en diferentes tiendas donde le den precios bajos para el así poder ganarle algo. El esta casado con la señora Yunuen y tienen un niño el cual estudia la primaria, uno de sus sueños es tener un local propio en su casa para no tener gastos de la renta. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Irma, Tersa, Eduardo, Beatriz Elizabeth, María Alejandra, Pablo, Janet, Olga ellos invertirán sus créditos en sus negocios de refaccionaria, frutas y legumbres de temporada, productos para estética, zapatos y ropa para dama por catalogo, en una pollería, en una peletería y en una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 30 years old and says that he completed his studies up to the third year at the local high school. After seeing no future in his town, he decided to move a few years later to Mexico City where he enrolled in beauty school and learned the skills of the trade very well. As a young boy, he enjoyed giving haircuts so he chose this career because he saw that it would be a good business. He now has an aesthetics practice in town that he started seven years ago. One of his challenges is being able to pay the rent since the rates have gotten so high. Rodrigo says that he is requesting a loan to buy beauty products such as crèmes, makeup, nail polish for manicures and pedicures, shampoo, dyes, bleaches, and liquid products used on the hair. He indicates that all of the products that are used on his customers are purchased in Mexico City from different stores that offer low prices. This allows him to earn some profit. Rodrigo is married to Sra. Yunuen and has a child in elementary school. One of his dreams is to open a shop in his home so that he can avoid paying rent.

The other group members are Irma, Teresa, Eduardo, Beatriz Elizabeth, Maria Alejandra, Pablo, Janet, and Olga. They will invest their loans in spare parts, seasonal fruits and legumes, styling products, women's clothing and shoes through a catalog, poultry, furs, and groceries.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, makeup, nail polish for manicures and pedicures, shampoo, dyes, bleaches, and liquid products used on the hair.

loans.name: Awal

texts.en:
Awal who is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all of them in school, lives in Bor, where she has been selling charcoal for three years.

Awal heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and is now requesting her first loan for 500 SDG in order to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: John Deere

texts.en:
John Deere is married and has two children.  He works hard to support his family.  He has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  He also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. 

John Deere is requesting his sixth loan through NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to buy spare parts for his motorcycle transport business. He hopes that his hard work will help his attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru:
Алмагул 44 года,  замужем,  имеет взрослых сына и  дочь. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи ,  20 лет назад Алмагул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве.  Стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Алмагул смогла развить хозяйство  с ежемесячной прибылью от продажи молока и молочных продуктов в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, поголовье скота Алмагул насчитывает 2 дойной коровы и 2 бычка, также Алмагул обрабатывает  2,5 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает зерновые культуры, клевер, служащие кормом для скота.
Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Алмагул  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров. Доходы Алмагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а в будущем – купить грузовую машину для транспортировки продукции.
texts.en:
Almagul is 44 years old, married, and has grown children: a son and a daughter. Searching of a source of income for her family, 20 years ago Almagul launched her business in animal husbandry and produce farming. Starting with an initial capital of 10,000 KGS, Almagul has been able to grow her farm, which now brigns in a monthly revenue of 20,000 KGS from sales of meat and dairy products. At present, Almagul’s livestock includes two dairy cows and two bulls. Almagul  also works 2.5 ha [about 6 acres] of arable land, where she plants cereals and clover used as animal feed.

In order to expand her business further, Almagul turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS intended for the purchase of two dairy cows. Almagul plans to reinvest her revenues in the business, and in the future to buy a truck for transporting products.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Mireya Rocio

texts.es: Mireya es una mujer de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su restaurante de comida rápida su historia empezó cuando su cuñado le aviso que había oportunidad de poner un comedor en una hacienda y le va muy bien, su trabajo lo hace con una señora todos los días, no tiene dificultades, es viuda, si tiene2 hijos, su sueño más importante es trabajar duro y tener su casa propia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su restaurante de comida rápida y asi comprar frutas, platanos, huevos para hcer desayunos.
texts.en:
Mireya is a 25-year-old woman who has many aspirations within the next few years of prospering her fast food restaurant. Her story began when her brother-in-law advised her about the opportunity to open a diner in her home. As a result, she has done very well. Mireya works with another lady every day and faces no difficulties. She is widowed and has two children.

Her greatest dream is to work hard and have a house of her own. For this reason, her loan will be used for her fast food restaurant. She will buy fruits, plantains, and eggs for preparing breakfast.

loans.use: to buy fruits, plantains, and eggs for preparing breakfast.

loans.name: Renato Carlos

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte (Anteriormente se llamaba Banco Comunal La Unión Hace la Fuerza). Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos al señor Renato, tiene 24 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de una  tía, estudia el octavo semestre de ingeniería  civil en una Universidad de Manabí, de la cual espera graduarse y así poder ejercer su profesión para su bien y el de su familia.

Él además de preocuparse por sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, vende  sabanas, cobertores de colchones, sobrecamas  y fundas de almohadas las mismas  que su tía elabora y él se encarga de comercializar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y la mayor parte de sus ventas son  bajo pedidos que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas ya que en las tardes y noches tiene que dedicarse a sus estudios, gracias a este negocio ha podido seguir adelante en sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales para elaborar las  sabanas y cobertores elaborados. Este es el cuarto siclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos.
 
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place renowned for the delicious and nationwide famous pastries prepared by the locals.

Here we meet Renato, 24. He is single and the house he lives in his aunt’s house. He is attending the eight semester of civil engineering at the University of Manbí, and he hopes to graduate in order to practice his profession for his family’s wellbeing as well as his own.

On top of studying he also engages in trade, selling bed sheets, mattress covers, bedspreads and pillow cases: his aunt creates these items and he sells them door to door, and for the most part his customers place orders he then fulfills. He works every day in the morning, as afternoons and nights are dedicated to his studies, and thanks to his activity he has been able to keep on studying. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, threads and other materials to create bed sheets and mattress covers. He has been a member of the Communal Bank for four years and he likes it because the interest rates are low.

He dreams of completing his studies and of practicing his profession.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads and other materials to create bed sheets and mattress covers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his vehicle and to buy doors for it.

loans.name: Lourdes Angélica

texts.es: Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy, tiene 44 años, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, es madre de 3 niños, se dedica a la venta de comida y medicina natural, en sus casa cría cuyes, siempre trató de estar bien en Finca ella valora mucho todo lo que hacen por ella, en los momentos más difíciles le ayudaron, gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió muchas cosas, se pudo comprar sus artefactos e hizo el desagüe de su casa, también aprendió la manera de criar a sus hijos, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de velas y jabones medicinales.
texts.en: Lourdes is a member of the “Tu Ángel Lucy” communal bank; she’s 44 years old and has been a member of Finca Perú for five years.  She’s the mother of three children and she sells food and natural remedies.  She raises guinea pigs at home.  She’s always tried to be in good standing with Finca Perú; she values very much everything they do for her.  They helped her in the most difficult moments.  Thanks to the training she learned many things.  She was able to buy appliances and installed drainage in her house.  She also learned a way to raise her children.  Now, she will use the loan to buy candles and medicinal soap.

loans.use: to buy candles and medicinal soap.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy luchadora, tiene 62 años de edad y tiene 8 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven con ella solo dos de ellos, por circunstancias de la vida, ella quedo viuda hace ya varios años y debido a ello tuvo que trabajar para poder salir adelante con sus hijos, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, Ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete.
También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo, como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus paltos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”.

Debido a la pérdida de su esposo, Ana con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de alquiler de garaje, en el cual cuida autos, mototaxis desde hace ya 7 meses, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas, y puede atender hasta 40 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida y atiende con amabilidad a sus clientes.

Ana agradece a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá arreglar el techo de su garaje comprando lona, con esta mejora podrá ofrecer un mayor servicio en especial porque ya se acerca el invierno y los vehículos estarían más protegidos de la humedad, así seguirá trabajando para logran su gran sueño:” lograr que sus hijos terminen una carrera profesional”.
texts.en:
Ana is a hardwoking 62-year-old mother of 8 children, whom are all grown up. Only two of her children live with her. Due to the circumstances that life brings, she was widowed several years ago, and because of this, she had to work in order to get ahead with her children. Her home is located in the city of Imperial, which is known as a commercial center. Nearby is the Fortaleza de Ungará, the last vestige of the Huarco culture in ancient Cañete. You can also find old estates among the extensive crop fields. As every good Peruvian, she loves our country's traditional food, and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious Arroz Chaufa, a mix of fried rice, vegetables, egg, and meat.
Because of the loss of her husband, she had to work hard to launch her parking facility business, in which she has been looking after cars and motorcycle taxis for 7 months. She works for about 8 hours, and she can have up to 40 customers at a time. She believes that business is good because she is very well-known and provides good customer service. 
Ana would like to thank the Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to fix the roof of the garage by purchasing a tarp, thus allowing her to offer a better service, especially since winter is approaching and the vehicles will get more protection from the weather. That way, she will continue working so that she can reach her biggest dream: to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: to replace the tarps of her garage.

loans.name: Giselle Marjorie

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte (Anteriormente se llamaba Banco Comunal La Unión Hace la Fuerza). Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Giselle, tiene 39 años, es casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas  de 20, 16 y 13 años, la mayor esta en Universidad y las menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer de cooperativa intercantonal.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa y también se  dedica al comercio, vende ropa, joyas de Romanel y productos de Avon, Yanbal y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño bazar. La ropa y las joyas de Romanel compra en Chone y Guayaquil, lleva más de 8 años dedicada al comercio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa, joyas, perfumes, cremas y otros productos que ella vende. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es ampliar y surtir más su bazar.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place renowned for the delicious and nationwide famous pastries prepared by the locals.

Here we meet Giselle, 39. She is married and she has three daughters aged 20, 16 and 13. The eldest is a university student, the other two go to high school. Her husband is a driver for an inter-cantonal co-op.

She is a good housewife and she also engages in retail by selling clothes, Romanel jewels and Avon, Yanbal and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies). She works every day and she sells door to door. She also sells in her house, where she has a small bazaar. She buy clothes and Romanel jewels in Chone and Guayaquil, she has been engaging in this activity for more than 8 years and things are going very well.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes, jewels, perfumes, creams and other products to sell. She has been a member of this Communal Bank for more than 5 years and she likes it because of the help she has received through the loans.

Her dream is to expand and to better supply her bazaar.

loans.use: To buy clothes, jewels, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Asunción Paulina

texts.es: Asunción es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy, tiene 58 años, es dueña de una florería, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, y en todo este tiempo hubo como dos meses que se retiró, pero extrañaba mucho su Banco Comunal y eso le llevó a  regresar, al estar en las reuniones le ayudan y se relaja, la buena relación entre las socias le gusta, la comprensión, la responsabilidad y la puntualidad y la forma de apoyarse una a otras, aprendió a poder valorarse como mujer. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de flores, ya que por esta época  esta caro.
texts.en: Asunción, 58, is a member of the "Tu Ángel Lucy" communal bank.  She owns a flower shop.  She's been a member of Finca Perú for 12 years and in all this time she only dropped out for about two months but she missed her communal bank very much which led her to return; attending the meetings relaxes her and helps her.  She enjoys the good relationship among the members; the understanding, the responsibility, the punctuality and the way they help each other out.  She learned how to value herself as a woman.  She will use this loan to buy flowers since around this time they are expensive.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Evelyn Yamileth

texts.es:
Evelyn, es madre soltera de un niño de 7 años, vive en compañía de su madre, la vivienda es arrendada, tiene dos años de estar residiendo en el lugar, ella se dedica a la venta de mercería, pulseras, collares, aretes, maquillajes, entre otros, las ventas las realiza en las afueras de las escuelas.
Evelyn está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más productos, para surtir el negocio, ya que quiere ofrecer nuevos estilos de aretes, collares, pulseras, cosméticos, porque esto le permite que los jóvenes clientes siempre demanden de sus productos.
La aspiración de Evelyn es ampliar en negocio, fortalecerlo para tener mayores ganancias, además comprarse una casa o un lugar para construir y vivir junto a su familia en lo propio.
texts.en: Evelyn is a single mother of a 7-year-old boy. She lives with her mother and their living space is rented. She has been residing in that place for two years. She works selling notions, bracelets, necklaces, earrings, and makeup, among other things. She makes her sales in the areas around schools. Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy more products to supply her business with, since she wants to offer new styles of earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and cosmetics, because this enables her to always have her young customers seeking her products. Evelyn's aspiration is to expand her business, make it stronger to have greater profits, and furthermore buy a house or a place to build one and live together with her family in her own place.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Badegna est un regroupement de 6 femmes ayant en moyenne 35  ans, 5 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à Bounounkobougou, un des quartiers de la ville de YANFOLILA (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur dixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poisson avec  MAMA, de la restauration et de la vente de céréales.
MAMA arrêté avec un enfant sous le bras,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  100kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de YANFOLILA auprès des pêcheurs. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Yanfolila et à domicile à une clientèle mixte, en détail, au comptant et à crédit . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000.FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Badegna is a group of six women who are, on average, 35 years old and have five children.  They all live in nuclear families in Bounounkobougou, one of the districts of the city of Yanfolila, (the third administrative region of Mali).
They have taken out their tenth joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers.   Along with Mama, this group of women is in the business of selling fish and cereals, and food service. 
Mama, with the child in her arm, plans to buy 100 kg. of fish with her loan. She gets her supplies at the main market in Yanfolila from the fishermen.  She makes her sales at the market in Yanfolila and from home to a mixed clientele, at retail, for cash and on credit. 
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA.  A part of this will be used to assist her husband with daily expenses and the other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 45-year-old married father of three children. He has been working as an electrician for the past 25 years. He is energetic and hardworking, and has the experience to be a very skilled electrician. He has spent a great deal of time improving and developing his business, to ensure that his customers are happy with his services. Mohamad works with almost all of the constructors in his region. He also works for his neighbors and villagers. The high quality of his work has helped him gain customers' loyalty and trust.

Mohamad was introduced to Kiva partner Al Majmoua through a friend, who helped him apply for a loan in order to continue improving his business. He will use the loan to buy special updated electric tools necessary to improve his business. Mohamad works hard to provide his family with the best living, and he hopes he can continue to provide excellent services to his customers.

loans.use: To buy necessary electric tools

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a married woman who has two children. Mary Jane is 48 years old and resides at Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Mary Jane owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for 16 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2008, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. In the future, Mary Jane wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
Héctor, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él es obrero trabajando en albañilería, fontanería, ayudante de mecánico, de cualquier de estos oficios él consigue trabajos para generar ingresos a la familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una pulidora, esta herramienta la necesita para mejorar su trabajo, ya que en ocasiones la necesita para la albañilería o para fontanería, por lo mismo este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta necesidad.
El objetivo de Héctor es permanecer trabajando, para mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor lives with his wife and son.  He is a laborer working in construction, plumbing and as a mechanic’s assistant.  He gets jobs in any of these fields to generate family income.

He’s asking for a loan to buy a polishing machine which is a tool he needs to improve his work because he needs it sometimes for bricklaying or plumbing and the loan will help him meet this need.

Héctor’s goal is to continue to work to improve his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, es agricultor, vive en casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos y su esposa, él se dedica a sembrar dos manzanas de maíz y tres tareas de tomates, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de estar dedicado a esta actividad, es su fuente de ingresos familiar, además vende miel de abeja, trabajan todos juntos en familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la siembra de esta temporada, comprara semilla, abono y pesticidas, esto le ayudara para tener el dinero necesario para realizar la siembra y que sea abundante la producción.
La aspiración de Manuel es que su actividad agrícola sea mejor, ya que su familia depende de los ingresos que él genera.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in his own house with his 4 children and his wife. For approximately 30 years, his main income comes from farming and he also sells honey. He sows 3.48 acres of corn and 1,886.58 meters squared of tomatoes. His entire family works together.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies for this season’s crops like, seedlings, manure and pesticides. This loan will help him have the money he needs to grow his crop and make sure production is abundant.
Manuel aspires to a better crop this season because his family depends on the income he generates.

loans.use: buy seedlings, manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja, este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos, lo realiza de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  más ropa nueva, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, ropa para niños, la compra le ayudara para diversificar el negocio y fortalecerlo para un mejor servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de Francisco es tener un negocio grande, tener más clientela y proveerle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Francisco has a clothing business. He lives with his wife and two sons. He is the only one who works. He learned this business from his family, because he needed to have a source of income. He works as a street vendor, and doesn't have fixed hours. 

He is applying for a loan to buy more new clothing, skirts, blouses, underwear, and children's clothing. The purchase will help him diversify the business  and build it up, in order to serve his customers better. Francisco's ambition is to have a large business, to have more customers, and to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy new clothing, skirts, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Atilio Enrique

texts.es:
Atilio, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, él administra una venta de helados, trabajando con una empresa reconocida, está autorizado para tener el negocio en su vivienda. 
El está solicitando un préstamo para el pago de mano de obra, para aperturar un nuevo punto de negocio, en otro municipio, esto le ayudara para que los mozos le preparen el local, y poder iniciar labores en otro lugar, creciendo más dentro del mercado.
La aspiración de Atilio es mejorar su inversión, aperturando este nuevo local, espera que sea de provecho.
texts.en:
Atilio lives with his wife and 2 young children. He administrates an ice cream shop for a well-known company and is authorized to sell from his house. 

He is requesting a loan to pay the manual labor of opening another ice cream shop in another municipality. This will help with the preparations of a new shop and initiating business in another area will allow him to grow his business inside the market. Atilio aspires to improve his investment by opening this new location and hopes it’s a success.

loans.use: to pay the manual labor of opening another ice cream shop.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia.
