Ella posee una venta de ropa, camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos entre otros es muy conocida en la zona pues vende de forma ambulante en las cercanías de donde vive o desde  su casa además todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles; María es una mujer joven y enérgica muy dedicada a su labor piensa que la superación de cada persona es un proceso de transformación y desarrollo que te ayuda a lograr la felicidad, ella ya comenzó ese proceso y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo que le permita comprar ropa, sandalias, zapatos en variedad y por mayor. María Elena tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
María Elena, 34 years old, lives with her life partner and daughter in her own house. She has a clothing store, where she sells shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses, among other things. She is very well known in the area because she sells as a street vendor near to where she lives or in her own house. Furthermore, everything she sells is of very good quality and it has accessible prices. 

María is a young and energetic woman; she is very dedicated to her work. She thinks that each person’s improvement is a process of transformation and development that helps you reach happiness. She already started this process, and that is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to purchase a variety of wholesale clothes, sandals, and shoes. Maria Elena has faith that, in this manner, she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, esto porque está iniciando los cultivos de maíz, comprara abono y herbicidas, con estos materiales iniciara los preparativos de la tierra, con la esperanza de tener una buena cosecha.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar la productividad de maíz, además de que cancelo bien y logro generar algunos ingresos.
texts.en: Pedro has decided to apply for a new loan because it is time to plant more corn. He will buy fertilizer and herbicides and use those materials to start preparing the land, with hopes of a good harvest. He believes his last loan helped his corn grow better and he was able to repay the loan responsibly and earn some money.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es: Doña Bertha es la coordinadora del Banco Comunal Alegria, tiene 60 años de edad, procreó seis hijos, es soltera y reside en la Aldea San Nicolas. Bertha se dedica a la compra de cerdos para luego destazarlos y vender su carne en algunas carnicerias. El negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y cuando ella se fue de su casa tuvo que buscar una actividad economica con la cual sostenerse, asi que puso en practica lo que sabia que era criar cerdos. Ella esta solicitando este prestamo para la compra de varios cerdos y mejorar la galera donde estos habitan. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podrá seguir llevando el sustento a su familia. Su meta es ir dejando un porcentaje de sus ganancias para instalar una pulperia en su casa de habitacion y poco a poco irla surtiendo hasta llegar a tener un mini-mercadito. Con el apoyo de los prestamos obtenidos en FAMA ha hecho crecer su negocio y eso le ha permitido mejorar sus ganancias e ir cancelando puntualmente las cuotas de sus prestamos. Las demas compañeras de grupo se dedican a diferentes a la venta de: nacatamales, productos de belleza, ropa, golosinas y productos de uso domestico.
texts.en:
Bertha is coordinator of the “Alegría” communal bank.  She’s 60 years old and had six children.  She’s single and lives in the village of San Nicolás.

Bertha buys pigs that she then butchers to sell the meat to butcher shops.  She learned the business from her parents and when she left home she had to find an economic activity to support herself so she put into practice what she knew which was how to raise pigs.

She’s asking for this loan to buy several pigs and to improve the sty they live in.  With support from this loan she will be able to continue to provide sustenance for her family.  Her goal is to save part of her profits to set up a grocery store at home and gradually stock it to become a mini-market.

With support from FAMA loans she’s caused her business to grow which has allowed her to improve her profits and gradually pay back her loans.

The other group members are in a variety of sales: nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales], beauty products, clothes, snacks and domestic use products.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos de 13 y 20 años y la casa es propia, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, la tiene desde hace 6 años, la inicio con la ayuda de su esposo y trabaja atendiendo a los clientes todos los días.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arroz, huevos, azúcar, aceite, para incrementar el negocio, diversificando los productos para los clientes, ya que esto le aumentara sus ventas y la preferencia de los clientes.
La aspiración de María es que el negocio sea prospero, sacar su familia adelante, con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and her two children, ages 13 and 20. She has her own house. She runs a store selling household products, and has had it for six years. She started it with her husband's help, and works every day serving customers. 

She is applying for the loan to buy rice, eggs, sugar, and cooking oil, in order to increase her business by diversifying the products for the customers. This will increase her sales and customer preference for her business. Maria's ambition is to see her business prosper; to help her family succeed and have everything they need.

loans.use: To buy rice, eggs, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Patron San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Eulalia; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia vende sus productos a sus amistades, familiares y personas que le solicitan bajo pedido, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de artesanía, pasamanería, venta de golosinas, proyectos de obra.

Los socios que aparecen en la parte superior de la foto son socios que por motivos de trabajo pidieron permiso para llegar un poco tarde a la reunion.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Eulalia belongs to the “Patrón San Sebastián” communal bank which is located in Wanchaq District in Cusco Province and Department.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of beauty products like creams, perfume, cologne and creams, among others.  She’s been in this business for years and supports her family with it.  She sells her products to friends, family members and to people who place orders with her.  She is a very cheerful, responsible person who very much wants to get ahead for her family.   She requested the loan to buy more merchandise for her business selling beauty products like creams and perfume.

The other members are merchants selling crafts, decorative lace and ribbons, and snacks and work projects.

The members who appear at the top of the photo are members who due to work reasons asked permission to arrive a bit late to the meeting.

The member uses this means to express her gratitude to those who make the loan possible and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nubia Aleyda

texts.es: Nubia Aleyda de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, leche, huevos, pan entre otros, últimamente se  ha hecho de  mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es excelente siempre recibe a las personas con gran amabilidad; Nubia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que la superación es el valor que motiva a la persona a perfeccionarse a sí misma, es por eso que está motivada a hacer crecer el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, huevos, productos instantáneos etc. Nubia Aleyda tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nubia Aleyda is 30 and lives with her life partner and their children. She has a store in her home where she sells basic household necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. 

Lately she has gotten a lot of customers, as everything she sells is of very good quality, and she sells it at really affordable prices. In addition, the service is excellent; she always greets people in a very friendly way. 

Nubia is an enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed. She believes that overcoming challenges is the value that motivates a person to improve themselves. That is why she is motivated to make the business grow. That is why she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, drinks, candy, eggs, instant products, etc.

Nubia Aleyda has faith that this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, drinks, candy, eggs, and instant products.

loans.name: Ivette Marjore

texts.es:
Ivette, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que tiene la necesidad de reparar el horno de gas y tambien fabricar otro horno artesanal,  con este préstamo podrá ella comprar los materiales necesarios para la fabricación del horno, como arena, cemento, tierra, ladrillos y mano de obra, además pagara el eléctrico que le reparara el horno de gas.
Ella considera que a través de los prestamos estará en una mejor condición, ya que depende de la actividad que realiza preparando pan para vender.
texts.en: Ivette decided to apply for a new loan since she needs to repair her gas oven and also build another oven. With this loan she will be able to buy the necessary supplies for building the oven, such as sand, cement, dirt, bricks, and pay for labor. She will also pay the electrician who will repair her gas oven. She believes that the loan will allow her to improve her quality of life, since she depends on her work preparing bread to sell.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, dirt, bricks, and pay for labor

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, aged 22, is married to Hannah and the father of a two-year-old child. With a good credit history John, who operates a motorcycle transport business that earns him a monthly income of KES.21,000, is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD. to buy another motorbike. He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, a 63-year-old widowed mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. In addition to buying and selling rice, she has operated a general store in the Philippines for nine years.

Having borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF, Leonila is now requesting a PHP 12000 loan to purchase more store stocks to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more store stocks to sell.

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, frijol, maíz, arroz y también yuca, tiene muchos años de vivir cerca de la zona donde cultiva y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo su producto es de excelente calidad y a muy buen precio, además el servicio es inigualable; José es un hombre trabajador muy activo y siempre dispuesto a aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que el que tiene motivación y disposición de superarse, puede llegar a construir su propio destino, el está lleno de motivación es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar Semilla por mayor de frijol, maíz, arroz, abono y yuca. José María tiene la confianza que con su trabajo podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José María is 55 years old and lives with his life partner and their children.  He farms basic grains: beans, corn and rice and also has manioc.  He has lived near the area where he farms for many years and he’s attained quite a few customers because all of his products are of excellent quality and of very good price.  Besides, he provides unequaled service.

José is a hardworking, active man always ready to take advantage of opportunities that arise.  He believes that he has the motivation and disposition to improve; he can create his own destiny.  He is full of motivation and this is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy bean, corn and rice seeds at wholesale and manure and manioc.  José María trusts that with his work he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bean, corn and rice seeds at wholesale and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale and two cylinders.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel, aged 36, is married to Eunice and they are blessed with seven children. A farmer for six years, Joe is now requesting his second loan from KADET LTD., his first already repaid. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, and hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertiler and seeds.

loans.name: Esther Noemi

texts.es:
Esther tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y cuenta con casa propia en la que viven y esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Muy Finca Paredones” el cual pertenece al distrito de Mochumi a una hora aproximadamente al norte de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. Es un caserío pequeño de aproximadamente 20 familias, y por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Esther se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales desde hace mucho años atrás, a la fecha ya tiene buena cantidad de clientes a quienes visita de manera semanal ofreciendo su ganado y recibiendo sus pedidos con los que tiene que cumplir, su esposa la apoya con los ingresos diarios trabajando como jornalero en los fundos cercanos a su caserío, pues ellos se han propuesto a pesar de su juventud mejorar su calidad de vida y buscarle mejores oportunidades escolares a su menor hijo. Ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles con los que comprará alimentos balanceados y a la vez mejorará las instalaciones de sus corrales para su mejor mantenimiento de su ganado.

Tiene muy buenas referencias con respecto a su personalidad y a su forma de trabajo, no solo de sus vecinos si no que también sus clientes la estiman y admiran mucho.
texts.en:
Esther is 24 years old, married and has a son.  She has her own home, in which they live, and is located in a rural village named "Great House Walls", which belongs to the district Mochumi about an hour north of City of Chiclayo. It is a small neighborhood of about 20 families, and for now, the only the only public service available is electricity. 

Esther has been dedicated to breeding, developing and marketing animals for many years now.  At this time, she has plenty of customers who visit her weekly to sell their goods and place orders with her.  Her husband supports her with his income as a farm laborer in a neighborhood nearby.  They are determined, despite their youth, to improve their quality of life and seek better educational opportunities for their young child. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 3000 soles [$1125 dollars] to buy livestock feed and improve their pens to better maintain their livestock.

She has many good references regarding her character and work ethic, not just from her neighbors but also from many of her clients that admire her and hold her in high esteem.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and improve their pens to better maintain their animals.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en: Ma. Luna is 48 years old, married, and has three children. With one child in school, Ma. Luna works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Luna runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair) in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell. Ma. Luna has been in this business for seven years. In the future Ma. Luna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products (nipa) to sell

loans.name: Mae

texts.en: Mae is 42 years old, married, and has six children. Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. Mae has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a restaurant. Mae aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 46 years old, married, and has four children. Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Mary has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Blanca Idalia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de refrescos y tortillas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, este negocio de Blanca le permite tener una ocupación y poder generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, dicho negocio lo tiene en su casa.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como el maíz, leña y cal, para realizar la venta de tortillas, con el préstamo podrá tener los materiales a mejor precio, comprando para mayor tiempo.
La aspiración de Blanca es con este préstamo que su negocio tenga más solvencia, aumentar las ventas y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca works selling soft drinks and tortillas. She lives with her husband and two children. Blanca’s business allows her to have an occupation and be able to generate income in order to support her husband with their home expenses. Her business is home based.
She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials like corn, firewood, and lime, so she can carry out the tortillas sale. With the loan, she will be able to have the materials at a better price, buying for a longer amount of time. 
Blanca’s aspiration for this loan is to give more solvency to her business, increase sales and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tlaltizapan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Tlaltizapan está conformado por la señora Ernestina va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, la señora María Dolores va a comprar blusas, pantalones y faldas. La señora Irma va a comprar arroz, tortilla, aceite, la señora Rosalba va a comprar cosméticos, la señora Ninfa va a comprar anillos y aretes de oro, la señora Yareli Yanet va a compara zapatos, la señora Anselma va a compra dulces paletas, chocolates, chicharrones, el señor Edgar Yair va a comprar blusas, pantalones y botas. 
La señora Anselma tiene 55 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 5 hijos, 2 varones y 3 mujeres, sus dos hijas gemelas estudian la preparatoria, ella vende dulces y chicharrones, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar dulces, corazones, chocolates, tazas con chocolates, chicharrones para la temporada del dia del amor y la amistad, ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años su abuelita le hacia los chicharrones para vender y ella aprendió de su abuelita a preparar la pasta para hacer los chicharrones, su negocio es importante porque tiene su propio negocio y no depende de nadie, ella se siente orgullosa de poder ayudar a sus hijas con los gastos de la escuela, sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijos construyan su casa para que no paguen renta y que sus hijas estudien la universidad para que tengan una profesión. Ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar dulces para que su negocio este bien surtido y bonito. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, que le vaya bien y que nos sigan prestando, con su ayuda podemos crecer en los negocios
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “Tlaltizapan” and consists of the following members: • Sra. Ernestina will buy soft drinks with her loan. • Sra. María Dolores will buy blouses, trousers, and skirts. • Sra. Irma will buy rice, tortillas, and oil. • Sra. Rosalba will buy cosmetics. • Sra. Ninfa will buy gold rings and earrings. • Sra. Yareli Yanet will buy shoes. • Sra. Anselma will buy lollipops, chocolates, and pork rinds. • Sr. Edgar Yair will buy blouses, trousers, and boots.

Sra. Anselma is 55 years old, married, and has five children – two sons and three daughters. Her twin daughters are preparatory school students. Anselma sells candy and pork rinds. She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, candy hearts, chocolates, chocolate cups, and pork rinds for the Valentine season. Anselma started her business 25 years ago. Her grandmother prepared pork rinds to sell and Anselma learned from her how to make the sauce that is served with this dish. Anselma’s business is important because she is her own boss and does not rely on anyone else. She is proud to be helping her daughters with their educational expenses. Her hopes and dreams for her children including building a house so that they can avoid paying rent and helping them get into a university in order for them to pursue a profession. Anselma is pleased with the loan she will receive because she will be able to buy candy so that her business is well-stocked and successful.

The members of this group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for these loans and we hope to do well. By continuing to lend to us, you help us grow in our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy sweets, candy hearts, chocolates, chocolate cups, and pork rinds.

loans.name: Awur

texts.en:
Awur lives in Bor. She is 34 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are still in school.

Awur sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years. She  heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fee.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 62 years old and married with 9 children.

Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs an electronic re-loading in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional load to sell.

Mary has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the electronic re-loading for 10 years. She also earns an income by selling distilled water and farming sugarcane.

Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional load to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a restaurant and earns a monthly income of  20,000 KES.

Damaris is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and rice. Damaris hopes to open another restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene mucha experiencia en la materia ya que lleva muchos años en el negocio agrícola, se ha hecho de mucha clientela y ha aumentado la demanda, pues todo lo que cultiva es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles; Julio es un hombre dedicado al trabajo, muy alegre y honrado, el piensa que el más grande secreto para llegar al éxito es la dedicación y la constancia en sus objetivos, el tiene la motivación y está dispuesto a dedicarse por completo a aumentar sus cultivos, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos semillas de maíz y frijol por mayor, abono entre otros. Julio tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia un nuevo impulso en búsqueda de su mejoría.
texts.en:
Julio, 55 years old, lives with his life partner and children. He works cultivating corn and beans, and has a lot of experience in the subject since he has worked a lot of years in the agricultural business. He has gained a big clientele; the demand has increased because everything he cultivates is of very good quality, and he sells at accessible prices.
Julio is dedicated to his work; he´s a very cheerful and honest man. He thinks that the biggest secret to success is having dedication and perseverance in his objectives. He has motivation and is willing to spend all his time increasing his crops. That is why he requests a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to purchase supplies of wholesale corn and bean seeds, and fertilizer, among other things. Julio hopes that, in this way, he will be able to give his family a new drive in the pursuit of their improvement.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn and bean seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio, aged 50, is married to Joan and they are blessed with three children. Emilio runs a retail shop that has been in operation for three years. Monthly income from the business is KES 48,000.

This is Emilio's second loan from KADET LTD. and has a good credit history. He will use the funds to buy sugar, rice, exercise books, cooking oil, wheat flour and sodas to sell. Emilio hopes to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, exercise books, cooking oil, wheat flour and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Awur

texts.en: Awur, a 42-year-old married mother of six children, four of whom are still in school, has been selling charcoal for three years. Awur heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is now requesting her first loan for 500 SDG in order to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income arising from the loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Colly

texts.en:
Colly is a farmer and a father of one child, aged 6, who is in schooling. Colly has been in farming for 12 years. He employs one farmhand and is producing mainly bananas, tea, coffee and milk for the local market. He does lumbering too.

Colly has requested a loan a loan of 70,000 KES, from Juhudi Kilimo, to help him buy a dairy cow and a chuff cutter to ease the feeding of his dairy cows. He has long term plans to expand his farm and later to even install an irrigation system on his farm.

He sees lack of enough water for farming as a challenge.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 47-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and living with his wife and four children. Two of the children are working and the others are still attending school.  

Hachem states that he has to work really hard to be able to have a good life. Hachem started to work in car trading in 2010, and he’s really satisfied for what he has attained so far. In addition, he has been working in a local company since 1990. Today, he’s looking to take a loan from kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase extra used cars in order to respond rapidly to his customers’ demands and, therefore, to increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to purchase extra used cars.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris,aged 27, is married and blessed with one child. He runs a retail shop that has been in operation for four years. Monthly income from the business is KES10,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to sell. Morris hopes to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en:
Nelius is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is aged 40 and has been in farming for 6 years. Her farm is currently providing employment to two farmhands and produces maize, beans and milk to the local market. She is single with one child, aged 14.

Nelius has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her construct a zero grazing unit for her dairy cows. She adds, such construction will help limit her expenditure on animal medicak treatments since the animals movements will be restricted and potential infections lowered.

Nelius points at unpredictable rains as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Duo Valle De La Alameda Group

texts.es:
Duo Valle de la Alameda.
este duo esta integrado por doña iris del Rosario tiene 21 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo dirio, desde hace 2 años,actual mente ha tenido que buscar un trabajo de medio tiempo,ya que por epocas las ventas bajan,pero ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos comestibles de consumo diario ya que nececita surtir mas su negocio,la siquiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa de paca.
texts.en:
Duo Valle de Alameda includes Iris del Rosario, who is 21 years old, and for the past two years has made her living selling products for daily consumption. Presently, she has had to search for a part time job, since there are seasons when sales are low. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more food products for daily consumption, as she needs to stock more items at her store. 

The other member is requesting this loan to purchase bundles of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for daily consumption.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 48 years old and is married. She has 3 children. With one child in school, Dina works very hard to provide for her family. Dina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Dina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, coffee, sardines, etc. In the future Dina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Edwin, a painter, and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Luzviminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luzviminda dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of bananas and charcoal business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more bananas and charcoal to sell for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 7 years. She earns additional income from raising and selling livestock.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money so she can afford to send her 4 children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more banana and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and has 6 children. She is married and has 3 children who are in school. Nida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nida has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 52 years old and married. She has 4 children. Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct business, selling Avon products, in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ninfa has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business (Avon products) for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending. Ninfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 38 years old and married with one child.

Elma works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Elma has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from electronic reloading, buying and selling of plastic wares, and raising pigs.

Elma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Duo Vida Y Amor Group

texts.es:
Duo Vida y amor.
este duo esta integrado por la señora, Sofia de 73 años de edad,ella se dedica a la elavoracion de güipiles, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque con el credito anterior pudo aumentar un poco mas sus capital,y ahora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima,para la elavoracion de güipiles ya que esta conciente de que le falta capital para trabajar,al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la misma actividad y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de Güipiles.el sueño de ellas es que algun dia puedan tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en: Life and love duo. This duo came together because of Sofia, 73, who weaves Mayan textiles. She’s been weaving for 10 years. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her income which made her happy. Currently, she doesn’t have the capital needed to be able to work efficiently and is requesting a loan to buy the materials she needs to make more Mayan textiles. Her associate also weaves Mayan textiles and is requesting the loan to buy the materials she needs. Their dream is to one day own a store where they can sell their products.

loans.use: buy materials needed to make Mayan textiles.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina tiene 33 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo ellos tiene 1 hijo varón de 14 años ya no quiso estudiar, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora cazuelas y ollas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar barro, leña y greta, ella aprendio este negocio hace 20 años desde pequeña ya que sus abuelitos trabajaban el barro y ella veía como le hacían y fue aprendiendo. Su negocio es importante para salir adelante con la familia, ya que del negocio sale el dinero para la comida y para seguir invirtiendo, ella se siente orgullosa cuando ve que sus productos le quedan bonitos,  las cazuelas y las ollas, su esposo y su hijo le ayudan a trabajar el barro.
Su negocio es conocido porque ya desde antes conocen la calidad de los productos que elaboran en su comunidad, ella utilizará las ganancias para la comida de todos los dias y otra parte la utilizara para comprar laminas de cartón para su casa.
Ella está feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar en comprar los materiales para ir trabajando. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes a su apoyo podemos salir adelante con los negocios y con las familias”.
texts.en:
Sra. Saturnina is 33 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. They have a 14-year-old son who is not in school. Saturnina makes pottery, such as casserole dishes and cooking vessels. She is requesting her loan so that she can buy clay, firewood, and glaze. Saturnina learned this business 20 years ago as a young woman from her grandparents who worked with clay. She watched and learned how these items were made. Her business is important because it enables her family to get ahead. The money from her business sales pay for food and reinvestment into her business. She feels proud whenever her products, such as casserole dishes and pots, turn out to be beautiful. Her husband and children help with the clay.

Saturnina's business is well-known because of the quality of the products she makes in her community. She will use her earnings to pay for all of the food her family consumes every day and part of the money will be used to buy sheets of cardboard to use around the house. Saturnina is happy with the loan she will receive so that she can buy the materials for her work.

The members of this group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for these loans. Thank you for your support because we are able to move forward with our businesses and our families."

loans.use: to buy clay, firewood, and glaze for making casserole dishes and pots.

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca y su esposo son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.
Solicitan el préstamo para los acabados del exterior de su vivienda ya que les esta haciendo falta la enjarres y pinturas de las paredes de la casa.
Doña Blanca es empleada de una taquería como cocinera y su esposo es despachador de una compañía de gasolina. Son los ingresos que tiene para la familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito. 
Desean mejorar el patrimonio, seguridad y la salud de su familia
texts.en:
Blanca and her husband are parents of a family with two children, both of whom are studying. They are requesting this loan to finish the exterior of their home, since they lack the plaster and paint materials for the walls of the house. 

Blanca works as a cook at a taco shop, and her husband is a dispatcher for a gasoline company. These jobs provide the income they have for their family, and part of that income will be used to pay back the loan. They want to improve their personal equity, security and the health of their family.

loans.use: to finish the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
Basilides tiene 69 años de edad es un señor casado que vive  en la zona rural de  la campiña San Nicolás -Lambayeque. Zona cuya actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Basilides a pesar de sus años, tiene que ver la manera de mantener su hogar y es por eso que desde hace dos año vende verduras en el mercado de Lambayeque, donde es conocido por la buena calidad de sus productos y por ello goza de una clientela ya establecida. Basilides adicionalmente cría y comercializa aves de corral (pato, pavo) y  también realiza actividades agrícolas, como la cosecha de limones.

Basilides solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 Nuevos Soles, cuyo destino será la compra de alimento balanceado y otros gastos personales que necesita realizar.
texts.en:
Basilides is 69 years old. He is a married man that lives in the rural area of San Nicolás - Lambayeque where the primary business is agriculture and raising livestock. 

In spite of his age, Basilides has to provide for his household. Because of this he has been selling vegetables in the Lambayeque market for two years. He enjoys a well established customer base because he is known for his high quality products. He also raises and sells poultry (ducks, turkeys) and works in agriculture, such as harvesting lemons. 

Basilides is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency]. He will use it to purchase food for his ducks and turkeys and to cover other personal expenses.

loans.use: buy food for his ducks and turkeys.

loans.name: Rosenda Maria

texts.es:
Rosenda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere comprar productos para el negocio, como el maíz, aceite, pollo, carne, condimentos, entre otros que son para ella de mucha importancia, ya que realiza mejores menús.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con su préstamo anterior, ya que le ayudo a suplir una necesidad y hoy en día se encuentra más estable.
texts.en:
Rosenda has decided upon a new loan because she wants to buy products for her business.  She wants to buy things like corn, oil, chicken, meat, and condiments, among others that are very important to her to make better set meals.

She states that she has had a good experience with her previous loan.  It helped her fill a need, and she is now more stable.

loans.use: to buy  corn, oil, chicken, meat, and condiments.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 53, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Bernardino, an employee, and a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elizabeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Elizabeth's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lonese

texts.en:
Lonese is 72 years old and widowed with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lonese has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lonese aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere reparar el techo del negocio y comprar mercadería para él, para el techo comprara láminas y para el negocio maíz, con esta inversion lograra tener más seguro el local y además tener la materia prima para continuar trabajado.
Ella considera que este préstamo le ayudara para seguir mejorando, los anteriores anteriores le han permitido mantenerse  y mejorar sus condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Alba is requesting a new loan because she wants to repair the roof to her business and to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy zinc sheeting for the roof and corn for her business.  

With this investment she will manage to have a more secure location, and she will have the raw material to continue working.

She feels that this loan will help her to continue improving.  The previous loans have allowed her to support herself and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and corn.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo,  la razón es porque iniciara el cultivo de maíz, para esto necesitara la compra de abono, herbicidas y semilla, para poder dar inicio a la siembra.
Él considera que estos préstamos le ayudan para mejorar la producción agrícola, ya que esto ayuda a su familia y a él principalmente.
texts.en:
José decided to request another loan. He’s about to start cultivating corn and he’ll need to buy manure, herbicides and seedlings to start planting.
He knows these loans help him to improve his corn production, and thus, help him and his family.

loans.use: buy manure, herbicides and seedlings.

loans.name: Jamale

texts.en: Jamale is a 39-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and her three children who are all studying.  She notes that without her husband’s support, she wouldn’t be able to fulfill her family needs.  Her husband has been working in the Lebanese army for five years.  As for Jamale, she started her own home business as a hair dresser in 2008.  She works independently and has her own customers.  Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hair tools in addition to some cosmetic products for her business.  She’s sure that this will increase her productivity and thus her earnings.  In the future, she plans to open her own hair dressing salon outside of her home.

loans.use: to purchase new hair tools in addition to some cosmetic products for her business.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is  a resident of Nkubu  and has been in active farming for five years with his farm employing one farmhand and producing  mainly maize, beans, green grams (lentils), eggs and tobacco for the local market.

Mark has requested a loan of 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a bull cart for transporting  mainly maize, green grams  and beans after harvesting to the stores as well as to the nearby markets. He says this will cut the cost of transportation which is quite significant when transporters are engaged for the service.

He says the major challenges in farming in the area are poor infrastructure and insufficient rainfall.

loans.use: To buy a bull cart

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 25, is a single man who runs a retail shop. The business has been in operation for four years and gives him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy flour, sugar and rice for sale. Francis hopes to open a supermarket in future.

loans.use: To  add more stock of  flour, sugar and rice for sale

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a 24-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Jenalyn has had a sari-sari (variety) store for 4 years. She sells snacks, canned goods, instant noodles and  various  other items. Jenalyn earns about 6000 PHP per month with her business. She is able to provide for her family's daily needs.

Jenalyn has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. Jenalyn hopes for her business to grow and for her family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more items to sell such as rice and canned goods

loans.name: Jose Irrael

texts.es:
José, necesita otro préstamo para el mejoramiento de la vivienda y compra de harinilla para los cerdos, él quiere reparar y asegurar el techo de la vivienda, comprando láminas nuevas para instalarlas, esto le ayudara para que su familia este mas segura y en mejores condiciones en el hogar, protegidos por cualquier situacion.
Él está considerando que el trabajo con créditos le ayuda para mejorar y prosperar económicamente con su familia, ya que el anterior le dio los insumos para realizar la siembra.
texts.en:
José needs another loan to improve his home and to buy coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran and yellow corn for the pigs.  He wants to repair and secure the roof of his house.  He will buy new zinc sheeting and install it.  This will help his family to be more secure.  It will also put the house in better condition, protected in whatever situation.

He thinks that the work with the loans helps him to improve and prosper financially with his family.  The last loan gave him the supplies to do the planting.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran and yellow corn for the pigs.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Doña Maria Juana tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 35, 30, 25, y 23 años de edad, todos son independientes y viven aparte, ella vive con 2 nietos en la aldea Guaymitas de el Progreso, Yoro.
La actividad que le genera los ingresos a Doña Maria es un negocio de una pulpería. Desde hace 3 años logro establecerla,  gracias a sus ganas de obtener su propio negocio.  Empezó vendiendo churros y helados, con el tiempo logro surtirlo poco a poco con mucho trabajo y empeño y ahora ofrece productos alimenticios como (harina, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, arroz, verduras, y productos de abarrotería y toda clase de golosinas). Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio le va muy bien porque la demanda de los productos alimenticios es a diario. Atiende a sus clientes todo el día.
Doña Maria solicito su segundo préstamo de 14,000 lempiras para abastecerse de productos alimenticios para dar un mejor servicio de producto que tiene demanda.
Su meta es ampliar su inventario, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Juana is 54 years old and a single mother of four children (ages 35, 30, 25, and 23). All of them are independent and live apart from her. She lives with two of her grandchildren in the neighborhood of Guaymitas del Progreso, Yoro. Doña Maria generates income by managing a grocery business that she started three years ago. She is grateful for the profits she has gained from having her own business. Maria started out selling fried dough and ice cream, but over time she gradually stocked more inventory. Through hard work and effort, she now offers food products such as flour, sugar, lard, beans, rice, vegetables, grocery products, and all types of candy. She is very pleased with her business and has done very well because she has daily demand for food products. Maria Juana serves her customers every day.

She is requesting her second loan in the amount of 14,000 HNL so that she can restock with more food products, thus allowing her to provide better service that is in demand. Her goal is to expand her inventory so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, rice, sugar, lard, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Reina Alicia

texts.es:
Reina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio, comprando maíz, aceite, condimentos, chicharrón, para elaborar pupusas y tamales, esto le ayudara a mantener surtido y a la mano todo lo necesario para la elaborar la tienda.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una bonita experiencia con el préstamo anterior, que logro cancelarlo y mantener el negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting a new loan to buy materials for her business: corn, oil, seasonings, and cracklings, to make "pupusas" [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] and tamales.  This will help her stay stocked and have on hand everything necessary to prepare the store.

She says she had a nice experience with the previous loan, that she managed to repay it and keep her business well stocked.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, seasonings, and cracklings.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es: La señora   Porfiria se dedica a la confección de sombreros de cholitas, es cliente nueva esta es su primera secuencia dentro la institución,  vive en la ciudad de El Alto  es madre soltera tiene  tres hijos  uno  de 8 años que esta en la edad escolar y los otros dos `pequeños,  invertirá  su préstamo en la compra de una maquina over para costurar  mas sombreros ya que  tiene mucha demanda de sombreros por sus clientes,  se compromete en cancelar sus cuotas de manera puntual,  Porfiria tiene  ganas de progresar económicamente de esta manera  mejorar su situación económica y también el de mejorar la calidad de sus productos, La Sra. Porfiria se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Porfiria makes traditional hats.  She is a new client, and this is her first cycle in the institution.  She lives in the city of El Alto, and she is a single mother.  She has three children; one is eight years old and school age.  The other two are little ones.

She will use the loan to buy an overlock machine to sew more hats.  She has a lot of customer demand for the hats.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

Porfiria has a great desire to progress economically and to improve her financial situation.  She also wants to improve the quality of her products.

Porfiria is very grateful for the opportunity given to her by the institution.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 50-year-old married man, father of four children. He has been working in the transportation field for 32 years. He is a hard worker; his car is his only source of living, and through it he was capable of raising and educating his family members.

Hassane works as a taxi driver, and he also transports village students from/to school, during the school season. He has a very good reputation, and he works hard at keeping it this way, because it is his advantage among the competition. Hassane has to keep his car in good shape, to keep his business working. 

That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary urgent maintenance requested on  his car's engine. Hassane hopes to improve his business more and more in the future to open his own transport company.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48 years old, married to Sarafina, and they are blessed with three children. He runs a restaurant business that has been in existence for one year. His monthly income from the business is KES 49,600.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy food stock like sugar, wheat flour and rice. Paul intends to open another restaurant in future.

loans.use: To buy food stock such as sugar, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah, aged 41, is married to Lemaiyan and they are blessed with three children aged between seven and 16. She runs a boutique that has been in operation for three years. The business gives her a monthly income of KES 10,500.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy more clothes for sale. Milcah hopes to open another boutique in future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE”, inicia su decimo cuato ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes, donde  la señora Aurelia es la presidenta. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio: producción, artesanía, pelletería, servicios y comercio.

La Aurelia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada madre de tres hijos. Hace siete años que integra asociaciones comunales, trabajando desde ese entonces con el negocio de elaboración de polleras.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de telas de pollera) mismo que adquirirá de la Ciudad de El Alto y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido en las tiendas comerciales, todos los días.

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella menciona que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amigas por siempre" is starting its fourteenth loan cycle at the Andes regional office. There are eight members participating in this communal bank, where Aurelia is the president. The ladies' businesses are different, including retail, production, and services, handicrafts and fur trade. 

Aurelia is a 37-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of communal banks for seven years, working ever since in the skirt making business.  

The loan she will now receive is for increasing her merchandise (purchase of skirt cloth) that she will buy in the city of El Alto and after making the skirts she will sell them by request to stores, every day. 

When we asked her what she liked most about "Por Mujer" she mentioned that she liked the training.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, aged 40, is married to Ismael and they are blessed with two children aged 13 and 16 years. She sells tea leaves and has been doing this for eight years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy more tea leaves. Nancy hopes to open a wholesale business in future.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves

loans.name: Mary  Arlyne

texts.en:
Mary Arlyne is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Mary Arlyne is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Arlyne has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Karla Raquel

texts.es:
Karla, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, es comerciante de ropa, tiene 5 años de estar en el negocio, trabaja junto a su esposo, ya que de este negocio dependen ellos y sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de ropa,  ya que su propósito es que a través de este préstamo poderse fortalecer y darle un nuevo giro a su negocio, su compra será en blusas y faldas, además comprara ropa interior, esta compra le ayudara para superar.
El objetivo de Karla es mejorar la atención a los clientes y mejorar tambien las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Karla lives with her husband and two children, who are 8 and 4 years old. She is a clothing storekeeper and has been in business for 5 years. She works along side her husband, as they and their children depend on this business. 

She now requests a loan to buy a variety of clothing. Her intention is to strengthen and give a new spin to her business through this loan, so she will buy blouses and skirts, as well as underwear. This purchase will help her succeed. 

Karla's objective is to improve customer service and improve her family's living conditions, too.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 47, is a single mother of eight children aged between 15 and 25 years. She sells groceries which gives her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is her third loan from  KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy more groceries for sale. Elizabeth hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy  more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda, 62, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Linda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Linda's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Linda dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una joven madre de familia de 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su esposo en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Laynas” perteneciente al distrito de la Matanza en la Provincia de Morropón – Piura a mas de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. En su caserío la mayoría de sus vecinos se dedican a la agricultura y comercialización de ganado.

Actualmente Maribel también se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de ganado como vacuno, ovinos y caprino, para lo que ha instalado en la parte posterior de su casa corrales espaciosos son donde los cria hasta que obtengan su peso, y tamaño ideal para ser ofrecidos en los mercados de su provincia. Adicionalmente también se genera ingresos diarios dedicándose a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida oriunda de los incas) en una parte de su casa la cual esta acondicionada para recibir a sus clientes.
Ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1508 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán destinados para la compra de alimento balanceado y de insumos para la producción de su chicha y a la vez para arreglos de su local de venta. La unión entre ella y su esposo es que hace posible sus buenas intensiones de salir adelante.

 Se ha hecho muy conocida por ser una madre muy responsable y por la buena atención que brinda, pues sus vecinos la estiman y consideran mucho.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 26 year old young mother.  She has a son, and she lives with her husband in their own home.  Their house is in the rural settlement called Laynas, which is in the Matanza district, Morropón – Piura province.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Most of her neighbors in her settlement devote themselves to agriculture and selling livestock.

Currently Maribel also raises, fattens, and sells livestock like cows, sheep, and goats.  To do so she has set up spacious corrals in back of her house.  This is where she raises them until they are the ideal weight and size to be offered in the markets in her province.

She also generates daily income by selling “chicha de jora” (a corn based drink from the Incas) in a part of her house that she has set up to receive her customers.

She is now requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 1,508 soles.  She will use the loan to buy balanced feed and supplies for her chicha production.  She will also make repairs to her sales location.

The union between herself and her husband is what makes their good intentions to get ahead possible.

She has become very well-known for being a very responsible mother and for the good service she provides.  Her neighbors consider her to be a person they hold in high esteem.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed, to buy supplies for chicha (hard corn), and to make repairs to her sales location.

loans.name: Shukurbek

texts.ru: Шукурбек женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. В этом бизнесе он уже более 2-х лет. Он покупает скот и откармливает их в течении двух недель, а затем обратно продает за выгодную цену. Кроме скотоводства он занимается купле- продажей сухофруктов. В бизнесе помогает его брат. Шукурбек запрашивает займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Shukurbek is married and raising one child.  He is a very hardworking and kind person.  He has been in this business for over two years.  Shukurbek buys livestock and fattens it up for two weeks, and then resells it at an advantageous price.    Besides animal husbandry, he is also involved in buying and selling dried fruit.  His brother helps him in the business.  Shukurbek is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni to buy livestock in order to expand his business.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Cirilio Eugenio

texts.es: Cirilio es un hombre de 46 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su negocio de bazar, cabinas y tricimoto su historia empezó con la necesidad de tener un seguro y poder mantener a su familia, su trabajo lo hace con su esposa muy temprano, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casado la esposa atiende en la cabina y bazar, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener surtido el bazar y comprar otra tricimoto. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su negocio de bazar, cabinas y tricimoto.
texts.en:
Cirilio is a 46-year-old man who is married and has children.  He has many hopes for his stationery store, call booths, and three-wheeled motorcycle business to prosper in the coming years.  His story began with the need to have an investment and be able to support his family.  He does his job with his wife very early.  He has problems with crime.  His wife takes care of the booths and store.

His most important dream is have his store stocked and to buy another three-wheeled motorcycle.  This is why he wants the loan for his store, call booth, and three-wheeled motorcycle business.

loans.use: to buy items for his store, call booths, and tires for a three-wheeled motorcycle.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est constituée de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 33 ans, 7 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à Massablacoura, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.Les prêts précédents ont été bien soldés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires, du jardinage et d’articles divers de boutique avec  KADIA.
Arrêtée avec un enfant sous le bras, KADIA  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux cartons de cubes maggi , deux sacs de sucre et 1 carton de lait en poudre. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle est mixte, KADIA vend au détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000.FCFA  par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
SABALI consists of four women who average 33 years of age and seven children each. They live in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a district of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

This is their seventh collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. All prior loans were correctly repaid. 

Their activities include gardening, selling food condiments, and in KADIA’s case, selling sundries. She is the one holding a child in the photo. She will use her loan to buy two boxes of Maggi cubes (bouillon), two bags of sugar, and one carton of powdered milk. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers at the big market of Bougouni, and conducts her sales at the same market and from home, for cash or credit. She sells at retail to a mixt clientele.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFAF, part of which she will use to help support her husband with the daily expenses. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy sundries for resale.

loans.name: Agata

texts.en:
Agata is aged 36 and has been active in the farming business for 12 consecutive years. She currently produces and sells bananas, milk and maize to the local market. She is married with two children aged eight and two with the first one already schooling. She lives with her family in their rural home in Nkubu, Central Kenya.

Agata has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional income will first go into repayment of the loan and later on buying more land to boost her dairy farming. She is particularly keen on buying two more acres of land and adding three more dairy cows in the future.

She mentions insufficiency of rainfall and poor water harvesting as their major challenges. She however remains happy with Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, aged 29, is married and is blessed with two children. She runs a salon that gives her a monthly income of KES 40,000.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history.She will use the funds to buy hair products and a dryer. Mercy hopes to educate her children and own a beauty college in future.

loans.use: To buy hair products and a dryer.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
This is May, 47, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a mining employee, and a mother of her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

May retails processed meat product. What she basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers, then sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, processed pork, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

May hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Ntiwigunge/rbmb Group

texts.fr:
Amisa fait partie du groupe Ntiwigunge/Rbmb. Elle a 34 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 10 ans à 14 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Amisa est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique et les semences  sélectionnent. Dans les prochaines années, Amisa voudrait être un grand cultivateur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en: Amisa is part of the Ntiwigunge/Rbmb group. She is 34, and married with 3 children aged 10 - 14, 3 of whom are in school. She has completed 3 years of secondary education. Amisa is a rice farmer. This is her first loan with ACB. She will use her loan to purchase chemical fertiliser. Her growth strategy for the business is to use chemical fertiliser and selected seed. In the coming years, Amisa would like to become a major rice farmer in her region. With the profits, she intends to put her children through school, to care for them, and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  para la compra de materiales para el negocio, comprara maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, condimentos, aceite, estos son los más necesarios para la elaboración de las pupusas ya que quiere por el momento fortalecer esta actividad.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado para mejorar y contribuir con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting another loan to buy supplies for her business.  She will buy corn, "quesillo" [soft cheese], cracklings, seasonings, and oil.  These are the most necessary ingredients to make "pupusas" [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] because right now she wants to strengthen this activity.

She considers that the previous loan has helped her improve and contribute with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, "quesillo" [soft cheese], cracklings, seasonings, and oil.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, aged 50, is a single mother of two children aged 19 and 22 years. She runs a salon business that has been in operation for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 26,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy products like hair  chemicals, hair treatments and dryers. Rosemary hopes to open another salon in future.

loans.use: To buy products such as hair  chemicals, hair treatments, and dryers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 45, is married and blessed with five children aged between 6 and 18 years. He sells cereals and has been doing this for 11 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 6,800.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy cereals like rice, beans, and maize to sell. Joseph hopes to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals like rice, beans, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha tiene 23 años, se dedica  a  la venta de cotillones para distintos acontecimientos sociales no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene un hijo de 6 años, se dedica al  Servicio de cotillón desde hace 2 años, su tienda se encuentra en la localidad de  Torno, este es el primer préstamo que tiene con la institución, La Sra. Mirtha va a usar este préstamo para la compra de azulejos para su vivienda, ya que le falta hacer poner el piso,  Mirtha  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Crecer en clientela para si generar mas ingresos y por ende crecer en su negocio,  va a utilizar los beneficios del crédito  Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Mirtha se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 23; she makes a living selling party supplies for different social events. She is not married, but lives with her partner, with whom she has a six year old son. She has been providing party supplies for two years and her shop can be found in the town of Torno. 

This is her first loan with the institution. Mirtha is going to use this loan to buy tiles for her home, as she needs to lay the floor. Mirtha faces challenges in her business, which are, increasing customers in order to generate more income, and consequently expand her business. She is going to use the benefits the loan gives to improve her family's quality of life. Mirtha feels happy, and grateful for the support offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles for her home.

loans.name: Pedrino

texts.es:
Pedrino, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra productos para el negocio como el arroz, maíz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, productos instantáneos y enlatados,  para surtir el negocio y mantener en el buen servicio a los clientes.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ha servido para prosperar y que su familia cuente con ingresos más seguros.
texts.en:
Pedrino is requesting another loan to buy products for his business, such as rice, corn, sugar, oil, eggs, instant products, and canned goods, to stock the business and maintain his good customer service.

He considers that the previous loan has helped him to prosper and helped his family to count on a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sugar, oil, eggs, instant products, and canned goods.
