She established this business needing to earn her own income to support her children; being a single mother she's worked hard.  She sells her merchandise in an ambulatory fashion in neighboring communities.  She states that she's had good profits that have helped her continue reinvesting in her products.  She spends nine hours daily selling her products.

She is very grateful to ODEF for the financial opportunity they've givben her.  This is her second loan.  She will use the 15,000 Lempiras to buy cosmetics to resell, to increase inventory and to generate more income.  Her goal is to be able to obtain a stable locale where she can sell her merchandise and provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

location.town: Aldea el Edén, Sta.Cruz de Yojoa.

loans.name: Barot

texts.ru: Более 6 лет Барот занимается купле- продажей скота. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он ответственный муж и заботливый отец пятерых детей. Барот покупает скот и откармливает их дома в течении 2-3 недель, а затем продает за выгодную цену. Барот хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Barot has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over six years.  He is a very hardworking and kind person.  He is a responsible husband and caring father of five children.  Barot buys livestock, fattens it up at home for 2-3 weeks and then sells it at an advantageous price.  Barot wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni to buy livestock in order to expand his business.  He relies on your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Arzikul

texts.ru: Арзикул трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 20 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания и  мелочей. Его точка находится в центре кишлака и имеет много клиентов. Арзикул хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки продуктов для увлечения ассортимента продуктов. Арзикул надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Arzikul is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and raising two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products and trinkets.  His retail outlet is located in the village center and attracts many customers.  Arzikul wants to obtain a loan in the amount in 3000 Somoni to buy food products in order to expand his product selection.  Arzikul relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 63 years old and a mother of two children. She does quarrying to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to rent a productive plot of land for quarrying.

loans.use: To rent a productive site for quarrying

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a rice grower living at Sampaguita with his spouse and two children. He has been able to sustain his family's needs for daily meals and is very proud of it. He would like to keep earning funds and continuously finance the education of his children. In this matter, he is asking a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming so that he will acquire more crop yield at harvest-time. 

He hopes to keep improving his sales from the business. 

Ronald will be very happy and proud to see all his children to be professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Running a sari-sari (variety) store occupies the daily schedule of Rufina. She is 51 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She usually generates an income of about P3,000 monthly. She utilizes it for the business, meals and in paying monthly electric bills. 

She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store. She is hoping to meet her customers' demand for affordable prices of merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a hard-working farmer living at Solana with his family. He raises crop in order to sell them upon harvest. He has been in this business for over five years now. He inherited a hectare plot of land from his parents which he is cultivating and planting rice in it. Magda, Gregorio's spouse, is a house keeper and is nursing their two children. 

Gregorio joined ASKI and is asking for a loan of P10,000 to improve his farming business. He will buy five bags of urea (fertilizer) and insecticides to be applied to enhance the growth of his crops.

Someday, he hopes to achieve a plentiful harvest to earn money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy five bags of urea (fertilizer) and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is 41 years old, married, and has one child attending school. He has been in the farming business for 20 years now. His net income from every harvest season is used for his family's expenses and part of it is a revolving capital for the business. He also pays for additional laborers who help them plant and harvest rice in a hectare of ricefield.

Elvis is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to pay for labor costs in farming and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

Through his farming business, Elvis hopes to make his family live comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in farming and fertilizers for crop maintenance

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Growing rice to sell is the primary source of income that Benito and his family rely for their livelihood. Benito started this business 20 years ago. He is very proud that income through his business, he has provided a good education for his children.

Benito still wants to improve his crop production so he is asking for additional capital to use in farming. He needs P19,000 to buy herbicides and insecticides.

Someday, Benito would like to achieve abundant crops every harvest season that will lead him to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is an entrepreneur living at Baliuag with his wife, Jocelyn, and three children. To support the family, Jimmy has a furniture-making business to generate income. He has poured out his skills making cabinets, chairs and tables to sell as his business. He has been doing this for three years.

Now, he would like to improve his output so he is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy wood, a saw and a hammer to use in furniture-making. Someday, he hopes to make better sales from the business, thus improving the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, a saw and a  hammer to use in furniture making

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her child. She, together with her child, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos  en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de boletos de lotería por las principales calle de la localidad en la que vive, es muy buen vendedor y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha más clientela pues las personas saben que Mario es una persona confiable y vende a buenos precios, además el servicio es inigualable siempre recibe a la clientela con una enorme sonrisa en el rostro; Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado, se levanta desde muy temprano a empezar su labor pues sabe que solo triunfa el que persevera, su más grande secreto es la constancia y la dedicación de esta manera esta seguro que  logrará el éxito, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar boletos de loteria por mayor. Mario Ernesto tiene confianza que la suerte estará con él y su familia gracias al prestamo solicitado
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto lives with his life’s companion and their children in his own house.  He sells lottery tickets on the main streets in the area where he lives.  He is a very good salesman, and he has made a lot more customers lately.  People know that Mario is a trustworthy person, and he sells at good prices.  Also, his service is unparalleled.  

He always greets the customers with an enormous smile on his face.  Mario is a very hard-working and honest man.  He gets up very early to start his work.  He knows only those who persevere triumph.  His biggest secret is his perseverance and his devotion.  He is sure that this way he will achieve success.

That is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will allow him to buy lottery tickets wholesale.  Mario Ernesto is confident that luck will be with him and his family thanks to the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets wholesale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su nieto; ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, huevos, bebida, jabones entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado su clientela, pues la gente está satisfecha de que sea la tienda más surtida de la zona además los productos  son  de primera calidad y vende a precios accesibles; Santos es una mujer dedicada, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y hacer crecer su negocio, piensa que lo más importante para llegar al éxito, es la motivación y la perseverancia, ella está motivada y por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, jabones etc. Santos tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 64, and lives with her grandson. She has a store in her home where she sells basic household necessities such as beans, eggs, drinks, soaps, and other items. 

Lately she has increased her clientele, as people are satisfied that the store is the best-stocked in the area. In addition, the products are top-quality, and she sells them at affordable prices. Santos is a dedicated woman, with a great desire to succeed and make her business grow. She believes that the most important thing for achieving success is motivation and perseverance. 

She is motivated, and that is why she decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, instant products, candy, bread, soaps, etc. Santos has faith that in this way she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, instant products, candy, bread, and soaps.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hilda Casilda

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer de 36 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su producto por catalogo su historia empezó desde que le ha gustado tener mi propio ingreso por eso me decidí a poner mi propio negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es comprarme una vitrina grande y poner un local. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su producto por catalogo y asi comprar cosmeticos, perfumes, ropa ect.
texts.en: Hilda is a 36 year-old woman who aspires to prosper in the coming years.  She sells products through a catalog.  She started her business because she liked the idea of having her own income.  She works on her own, and she faces difficulties such as crime.  She is married and has children.  Her main dream is to buy herself a big glass display case and set up a shop.  She wants to use this loan to buy products from a catalog, including cosmetics, perfumes, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy products from a catalog, including cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Letty Orfilia

texts.es: Letty es una mujer de 45 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su producto por catalogo su historia empezó desde muy joven me gusto trabajar ser independiente y decidí que ya era hora de instalar mi negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es crear un local pequeño y incrementar mi negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su producto por catalogo y asi comprar ropa, bisuteria, cosmeticos.
texts.en: Letty is a 45 year-old woman who has many aspirations to succeed in the years to come.  She sells products from a catalog.  She began working when she was very young.  She likes working independently, and decided that it was time to have her own business.  She works on her own, and crime can be a problem.  She is not married and has no children.  Her most important dream is to establish a small shop and grow her business.  Consequently, she wants this loan to buy more products through a catalog, including clothing, accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy products through a catalog including clothing, accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol lives in Bor. She sells food in a stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. One is in school. 

Akuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for sale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 26-year-old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 9 months and 5 years. One is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Albert and he works as a businessman. Emily operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Emily’s other source of income includes selling of charcoal. 

Emily describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Emily will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and potatoes. Emily aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is still farming. Thanks to farming he is able to provide for his big family. His sister and grandmother now also live with him. 

Artak’s first loan allowed him to start pig breeding and thus to increase his family income. He is now requesting another loan for  800,000 AMD, which he will use to buy four piglets, two calves, and fodder.  Artak will use his future income to sow oats on his own plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, calves, and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 54 года. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жумакан занимается животноводством, начатым в 1991 году. Стартовав с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), Жумакан смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью около 14,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумакан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jumakan is 54 years old.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 1991 to provide a source of income for her family.  Having started the business with 20,000 som (KGS), Jumakan was able to grow her business to yield about 14,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to develop her business further, she requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  Jumakan plans to invest the earnings into a further increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, que está ubicada en un caserío cerca del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y solo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía electrica. La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza de aves de corral, pavos y gallinas los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 5 años en la parte posterior de la casa de sus padres. También cuenta con un pequeño terreno agrícola que su madre le ha dado como herencia. Allí, Noemi ha sembrado maracuyá la cual la cosecha semanalmente. Desea comprar más alimentos para el engorde de los pavos y gallinas para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal. Con esta inversión, Noemi podrá vender sus animales a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su negocio. Para lograr sus metas, Noemi ha creído conveniente solicitar su primer préstamo en el monto de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Noemi is 29, single, and does not have children. She lives in her parents' home, located in a settlement near Tambogrande district, a farming area in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. 

She lives in the rural part of this district, and only has basic electricity service. The borrower raises poultry, such as turkeys and chickens, which she fattens to then sell in the local market. She has been doing this for more than five years in the area behind her parents' house. 

She also has a small piece of farmland that her mother has given her as an inheritance. There, Noemi has planted maracuyá (passion fruit), which she harvests weekly. She wishes to buy more feed for fattening her turkeys and chickens so that they attain an ideal size and weight.  

With this investment, Noemi will be able to sell her birds at a better price and continue growing in her business. To achieve her goals, Noemi has thought it appropriate to apply for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Ajoh heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is taking another Kiva loan of KES 40,000. With the loan, she wants to pay school fees for her child who attends school. 

With the previous loan, she was able to improve her business and her monthly profits increased by 50 percent. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a hog raiser and been doing this for over a year. This serves as her source of income. Her spouse is a laborer in a farm and generates unstable income. Jenifer has two children. She is 20 years old and needs to earn funds for her family. She did not finish her education so she just got involved in raising hogs to sell. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability. Someday, she hopes to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds and medicines for sustainability

loans.name: Sofiya

texts.ru: София трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и заботливая мать двоих детей. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота, в бизнесе ей помогает сын. София содержит и откармливает скот дома, имеет коровник для них. Этим бизнесом она содержит свою семью. София хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Sofiya is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is a widow and a caring mother of two children.  She has been involved in buying and selling livestock with the help of her son for over five years.  Sofiya keeps and fattens up livestock at home, where she has a cowshed for it.  This business provides for her family.  Sofiya wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy livestock in order to expand her business.  She relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 39 years old. A business lady, she is married to Benjamin, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 15 years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Lillian will use the loan to buy more stock of  used clothes for sale. 


With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique.

loans.use: to add  more  stock of  used  clothes for sale.

loans.name: Urmat Group

texts.ru:
Анаркан – лидер группы «Урмат», ей 62 года, имеет 4-х взрослых детей.  Анаркан занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес после распада Советского Союза с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS).  Анаркан  обрабатывает 4,50 га земли с фасолью и картофелем, продавая затем урожай в сезон.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в оборудование своего дома паровым отоплением. 

Аскеру 30 лет, женат, имеет одного сына. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Аскер обратился в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Аскер планирует вложить в постройку сарая. 
 
Урмату 28 лет, женат, имеет трех детей. В целях развития своего бизнеса, Урмат обратился в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрений.
texts.en:
Anarkan is the leader of the "Urmat" group.  She is 62 years old and has four adult children.  Anarkan is involved in farming, having started this business with 20,000 som (KGS) after the breakup of the Soviet Union.  She works on 4.50 hectares of land, growing beans and potatoes and then selling the harvest during the season.  In order to continue developing her business, Anarkan requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into provisioning her house with steam heating.

Asker is 30 years old, married and has one son.  In order to develop his business, he requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers.  Asker plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a barn.

Urmat is 28 years old, married and has three children.  In order to develop his business, he requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 30 years old and married with one child. He sells vehicle spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has employed three people. To earn extra income  he does poultry farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business further in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare  parts to  sell

loans.name: Abuot

texts.en:
Abuot lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Abuot heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 1 enfant. 
Kokou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des articles de quincaillerie pour tous clients. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kokou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de quincaillerie. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kokou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou is a 28-year-old man who is married to a reseller. The couple have one child. 

Kokou started selling hardware items in 2010. He works alone, and buys his stock in Lomé. For the time being, his main hurdle is a shortage of merchandise. 

Kokou is seeking his first loan from WAGES to replenish his stock of hardware items. He wants to reinvest in his activity.
 
In the coming years, Kokou would like to expand the size of his business. He plans to use the profits earned to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy hardware merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 37-year-old married woman. She has two children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Omar and he works as a taxi driver. 

Angelina operates a retail shop business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Angelina's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Angelina will use the KES 30,000 loan to pay school fees for her child. Angelina aspires to open a new kiosk at the market in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol lives in Bor. She has a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Akuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice.

loans.name: Marcos Augusto

texts.es:
Marcos es un joven de 27 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica Perú; el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial de la siembre de esparrago y la cosecha de uva, asimismo en él se ubican varias agropexportadoras que brinda muchos puestos de trabajo en la zona, como buen peruano a marcos le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo arroz Verde, en su tiempo libre disfruta de jugar futbol con sus vecinos.

Marcos se dedica a su trabajo como chofer de taxi, el se dedica a su negocio alrededor d e10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y es honrado en su trabajo.
Marcos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su auto, con esta mejora su vehículo podrá estar en buenas condiciones para transportar a sus clientes y brindarles más seguridad, así seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida y ser Feliz”.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young man of 27, and lives in Santiago district, in the Ica region of Peru. Santiago district is noted for its farming, especially for growing asparagus and grapes. As well, several agro-export companies are located there, that provide many jobs in the area. 

Like a good Peruvian, Carlos really likes the traditional foods of our country, and one of his favorite dishes is the very delicious arroz verde (rice prepared with cilantro and vegetables). In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his neighbors. Marcos is a taxi driver, and works in his business for around ten hours a day. He thinks his work is going well because he is very friendly with the customers and he is honest in his work. 

Marcos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help that they have provided him he will be able to do maintainance on his car. With this work, his vehicle will be in good condition for transporting his customers, and offer them greater safety. This way he will continue working and striving to fulfill his great dream: "To improve his quality of life and be happy."

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more  products to sell.
